article_title: UAW Contracts Left Open Health Care Change
article_text:
The recent battles to win new four-year labor agreements with Detroit auto makers helped the United Auto Workers union reverse nearly a decade of givebacks, but the contracts allow for a change to health care plans that could reverberate on workers.

Left open in the drive to win higher pay for union members was how the auto makers will handle their contracts’ health-care costs when a federal tax on high-cost health insurance plans...

twitter.description: United Auto Workers contracts with U.S. car makers allow for them to impose deductibles on veteran union workers if the companies face unexpected costs due to looming excise tax on high-cost plans.
twitter.title: UAW Contracts Left Open Health Care Change

image.alt: UAW contracts provide for health plan deductibles that auto makers could impose.
